reviews.review_msg: Hilarious prof, very interested in the topic and is available to help you out and make adjustments should you have a good reason. He goes off on tangents like others have mentioned but oftentimes, they do relate to the points he's trying to make.

Probably one of the most entertaining and knowledgeable professor that I've had at SFU so far. Extremely charismatic and hilarious. He definitely does go on tangents (he admits it), but it's part of what makes his classes fun and different.

obsessed with Marx, and talks about it constantly when it does not apply. Talks about his own opinion and does not teach the course with an objective view at all. Also tends to talk a lot in general and tends to go over class time.

Nice lady, but OMG most boring, dry lectures. I struggled to stay awake. She doesn't actually give a lecture, just reads word for word off her slides, which have the exact same info as textbook but less coherent/organized. You lose marks if you skip lecture though.I didn't know a person could say "um" so many times in 2 hours...

The class is very dry but Fred does an amazing job with making things easy to understand and interesting! He's such a caring prof and wants all of his students to succeed. His final exam is not held during final season so that's a yikes! Assignments can be a little confusing but the labs/tutorials really help! Favorite class of the semester.
chris is soooooo nice, everything you need to know is on the lecture slides, don't bother with the textbook.

Chris is honestly so caring and such a sweet professor. He genuinely cares and he knows that Q credit classes tend to scare people, so he simplifies the course and makes it as easy as possible. As long as you go to lectures it's a relatively easy course, considering it's 4 credits. Can't say enough good things about this guy!

This semester, I was fortunate to have Mr. Jeschelnik as an instructor for two of my courses and a lab instructor for another one. One may think that having the same teacher for almost all of your classes can be boring however, it was quite the opposite.

Let me begin this review by mentioning that I am taking a total of 3 courses this semester and Chris is the instructor of two and the teaching assistant for the third one. This term so far is the most fun semester of my entire academic journey and I owe it all to Mr. Jeschelnik.

Ahmad was a great professor, and he was super organized in his lectures, readings and any given assignments. The class was 4 credits, and was switched to online, but still he managed to get things ready for students. I would love to take another course with him in the future .

unorganized, would go through important topics as fast as he could. i didn't like his teaching method because it seemed like he was unfamiliar with the material. im sure he is knowledgeable however i found it extremely hard to be engaged in this class.

Worst Communications Prof i have ever had. There are 4 quizzes in total for this class AND a cumulative final 'Quiz' worth 20%. He zips right through lecture material so fast. He literally always says "Im going to go through this as fast as i can" all the time, so you cant take any efficient notes in preparation for the quiz's. Useless lectures.
